bibl.title: Despatches from United States Consuls in Boma, 1888-1895
bibl.publisher: National Archives and Records Service General Services Administration

div1.ab: Consular of the United States of American at Bathursh 23 April 1859
div1.p:
Sir,
I have the honor to inform you, that having again applied to His Excellency Governor as Commercial Agent of the United States temporarily subjects to the approval of Her Majesty's Government; I have received in reply his Despatch dated the 11th. Instant, granting my request: which I now beg to enclose.
Nothing now remains but that; the Exequaton may be forthcoming as soon as possible.
div1.ab: The Honorable Lewis Cao Secretary of State Washington
div1.p: On the 14th instant the Flag of the United was hoisted on this Conuslatee for the first time in Gambia, in fact I believe for the first time on the West Coast of Africa.i.e. British Colonial.
I am much inconvenienced by not having yet received a Consular Seat or the cases from Monrovia containing the Record Books stationary ic.
I hope to have the honor to receive a replu, to my several Despatches since my arrival here, by the Coming mail due on the this proximo.
I have the honor to the, Sir, Your Obident Servant, Daniel R.B. Upton U.S. Commercial Agent
